datafield.subfield: Initial probe of $\delta_{CP}$ by T2K with combined electron neutrino appearance and muon neutrino disappearance

T2K is a long-baseline neutrino oscillation experiment in which a $
u_{\mu}$ beam is produced at the J-PARC facility and detected 295 km away by the Super-Kamiokande, water Cherenkov detector. Up to May 2013, T2K has accumulated $6.57	imes 10^{20}$ protons on target, approximately 8\% of the experimental goal. T2K has observed 120 $
u_{\mu}$ candidates, which show a clear disappearance oscillation pattern, and 28 $
u_e$ candidates, with which $
u_e$ appearance was established. The measurement of $
u_e$ appearance is particularly important because it enables us to determine $\delta_{	extrm{CP}}$ when $	heta_{23}$ and $	heta_{13}$ are known. Using values of $	heta_{23}$ determined by T2K disappearance measurements and $	heta_{13}$ measured by reactor $ ar{
u}_e$ experiments, T2K has obtained the first constraint on $\delta_{	extrm{CP}}$ from a $
u_e$ appearance measurement.
